RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 78. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 22000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $25,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lb s.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 31 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 30 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NEWSDLEY roused up the rail to set the pace with a clear lead, flattened out in deep stretch but held on. SUGAR SMILE chased the leaders through the turn then slipped up the rail in the stretch but ran out of ground but proved second best. SEA ART was slightly reluctant to load, then had brief speed away from the gate, settled off pace in the two path, matched strides through the turn on the inside of ME DARLIN KATHLEEN and kept on but was outfinished. ME DARLIN KATHLEEN tracked the leader down the backstretch from three wide then matched strides with SEA ART through the turn and weakened. NAIL POLISH hesitated at the start spotting the field several lengths and was outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Newsdley
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, clear lead, held on

ENTRY.NAME: Me Darlin Kathleen
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leader 3w, duel turn, weakeneed

ENTRY.NAME: Sugar Smile
ENTRY.OWNER: Pewter Stable and Sardello Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased leader, slip up rail, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Nail Polish
ENTRY.COMMENT: hesitated start, outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Sea Art
ENTRY.COMMENT: reluctant, brief speed, off pace, duel turn, outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 5F Dirt CR: 51. Maiden Claiming Purse 17000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 118 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, if for $14,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CONTEMPTUOUS MISS settled off the pace then was coaxed at the quarter pole and ran down the leader in the final yards to prevail. BERNIE'S DREAMING prompted the pace from the two path to the middle of the turn then sprinted to a clear lead but was collared in the final yards. MARIA SAYS SO tracked the leaders while racing four wide throughout and passed tiring rival in the stretch. TWIN E was off a step slow then hustled to the front to take the lead to mid turn and tired. PER RULING #23124PN FROM THE PENNSYLVANIA RACING COMMISSION, CONTEMPTUOUS MISS WAS DISQUALIFIED FROM 1st TO UNPLACED PER HISA RULE ON EXCESSIVE CROP USE.

ENTRY.NAME: Twin E
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, hustle to lead, tired

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Contemptuous Miss
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, coaxed 1/4, ran down leader, prevailed,

ENTRY.NAME: Bernie's Dreaming
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt pace, drew clear, collared late

ENTRY.NAME: Maria Says So
ENTRY.OWNER: Bruno Ralph and D and D Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leader 4w, passed tiring rival

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 1M Turf CR: 77. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 18000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $16,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non -winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 31 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inad visable by management to run this race over the turf course it will be run on the main track at One Mile. If more than 10 horses remain it will be run at One Mile and Seventy Yards.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LUCKY RUNNING CAT was forwardly placed while saving ground down the backstretch, tipped out to two wide midway through the final turn then moved out to three wide in the stretch and made a late run to draw off. MISCHIEF WARRIOR raced in the middle of the pack around the first turn then moved up from three wide down the backstretch, saved ground around the final turn and fought gamley in the stretch to be second best. GETTIN'DOWNONIT sprinted to a clear lead to set most of the pace but was caught in mid stretch and tired. MACHO HONCHO raced near the back around the first turn then steadily advanced around the final turn then moved out to three wide in upper stretch to prove best of the rest. ROAN FOR THE ROSE was forwardly placed from two or three wide through the final turn and flattened out. RIVERBOAT BANDIT raced in the middle of the pack but failed to menace. THE MAN TO SEE was bumped on both sides leaving the gate and was allowed to settle around the first turn, steadily advanced on the backstretch and made a mild bid on the final turn but faltered. RED DEVOLUTION prompted the pace from two or three wide for a half and was done. OMERTA CODE was unhurried early and outrun. WICKED IRISHMAN was always back.

ENTRY.NAME: Macho Honcho
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, steady advance, 3wupper, best of rest

ENTRY.NAME: Omerta Code
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked Irishman
ENTRY.COMMENT: always back

ENTRY.NAME: The Man to See
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, allowed to settle, steady advance, mild bid, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Red Devolution
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt pace, 2-3w, done

ENTRY.NAME: Mischief Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, 3wbackstretch, saved ground, gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Running Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed, saved ground, 2-3w upper, drew off,

ENTRY.NAME: Riverboat Bandit
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Roan for the Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed, 2-3w, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Gettin'downonit
ENTRY.OWNER: Port Lairge Stables and Stevenson Louisa
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear lead, pace, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 63. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 18000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $16,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 31 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: UNION FOLLY went to the front to co-lead from the two path to the quarter pole then inched away and held on late. KAZ MUSIC stalked the pace down the backstretch then made a rail bid on the turn, tipped out to three wide in upper stretch for a late run but was not enough. LET'S GO MO was last away and trailed the field through the turn, made an inside late rally to be up for the show. MADI'S TUNE hustled along to co-lead from the inside to the quarter pole and tired. HAPPY RIDE chased the leader and never made a bid. UPTOWN SERAPHINA was off the pace from four wide but made a mild bid on the turn and tired in the stretch. MIGHTY GIN GIN vied for the lead from three wide to the three furlong marker then dropped back.

ENTRY.NAME: Let's Go Mo
ENTRY.COMMENT: last away, trailed, inside late rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Kaz Music
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, rail bid turn, 3wupper, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Madi's Tune
ENTRY.COMMENT: co-led, inside, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Union Folly
ENTRY.COMMENT: co-led, inched away, held on

ENTRY.NAME: Mighty Gin Gin
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied 3w, dropped back,

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Ride
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased leaders, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Uptown Seraphina
ENTRY.OWNER: Strunk John L Strunk Theresa A Baxter Ted R and Baxter Susan G
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 4w, mild bid, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 1M Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 11800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE FEBRUARY 28 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 31 Allowe d 2 lbs. Such A Race Since June 30 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WILL TAKE ROSES stalked the pace from the two path to the final turn then engaged the leader midway through the turn and matched strides to deep stretch, edged away to draw clear late. HIDDEN SPRINGS sprinted to a clear lead to the three furlong marker then was engaged by outside rival and dueled down the stretch while fighting gamely but couldn't fend off the challenge and proved second best. MANI PEDI saved ground from off the pace to the top of the stretch then drifted out to mid track but held on for the show. TONALA was unhurried through the final turn then made a late inside run to improve her position. MIKEY'S JEWEL was allowed to settle down the backstretch then went two wide on the final turn but lacked the late response. FAVORITE DOLL was taken up at the three quarter marker, distanced, eased and trotted in.

ENTRY.NAME: Mikey's Jewel
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 2w2nd turn, lacked late response,

ENTRY.NAME: Mani Pedi
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, off pace, drifted out stretch, held show

ENTRY.NAME: Favorite Doll
ENTRY.COMMENT: taken up 3/4, distanced, eased, trotted in

ENTRY.NAME: Tonala
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, late inside run, improved position

ENTRY.NAME: Hidden Springs
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear lead, engaged, duel stretch, gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Will Take Roses
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, match strides stretch, edged away late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 90. Claiming Purse 18100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE FEBRUARY 28 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 31 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Rac e Since June 30 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, if for $14,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COOL COMEDIAN prompted the pace to three furlong marker then moved out to three wide at the quarter pole, drove past the leaders at the eighth pole and drew off. CAERUS saved ground from off the pace to the top of the stretch then angled out to three wide at the eighth pole to make a late run but was second best. COLONEL MOORHEAD pressed the pace from the two path down the backstretch then engaged the leader at the five sixteenths pole and took a brief lead into the stretch but was overtaken at the eighth pole and weakened. SHANGHAI CANDY was unhurried down the backstretch then made a four wide bid at the three furlong marker, tipped in to the two path nearing the quarter pole and had to move back out to the four path in upper stretch and improved his position in the stretch. REBEL RULER went to a pressured lead to the three furlong marker then was headed at the five sixteenths pole, fought gamely to the eighth pole and tired. MY REDEMPTION was allowed to settle near the back down the backstretch then made a four wide bid at the seven sixteenths but failed to sustain that bid. FORECLOSURE was forwardly placed around the first turn then then made a mild bid on the backstretch and dropped back on the final turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Caerus
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, off pace, 3w1/8, late run, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Foreclosure
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed, mild bid, dropped back,

ENTRY.NAME: Rebel Ruler
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressured lead, headed 5/16, gamely, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Shanghai Candy
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, 4w3/8, 2wturn, 4wupper, improved position

ENTRY.NAME: Cool Comedian
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt pace, 3wupper, drove past, drew off,

ENTRY.NAME: Colonel Moorhead
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, engaged 5/16, brief lead, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: My Redemption
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 4w7/16, failed to sustain bid,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 61. Claiming Purse 11800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 31 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 30 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,0 00.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PAYNT BY NUMBER was hustled up the rail to be off the pace going into the turn, engaged the leader at the five sixteenths pole, edged away and drew off in the stretch. HIGHWAY QUEEN raced near the back down the backstretch then steadily advanced on the inside around the turn, angeled out to two wide at the sixteenths pole but was no match for the winner but proved second best. JUSTICE OR APPEAL sprinted to a clear lead to the three furlong marker then was headed at the five sixteenths pole and fought gamely to the eighth pole and weakened. SCOREBOARD LILY chased the leader through the turn then moved out to four wide in upper stretch for a late rally. ESTA CHUCK had no early speed and was not a threat. HOP TO A DECISION raced in the middle of the pack down the backstretch then dropped back on the turn and passed tired ones in the stretch. ROSE VALLEY was forwardly placed while racing three wide through the turn and lacked the late response. BOUND BY TRUTH was fractious in the gate and unruly when reloading, bobbled shortly after the break but was forwardly placed through the turn and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Justice Or Appeal
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear lead, headed 5/16, gamely, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Highway Queen
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, steady advance, 2w1/16, no match, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Esta Chuck
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Scoreboard Lily
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased leaders, 4wupper, late rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Bound by Truth
ENTRY.OWNER: Stites Christine S and Stites Tracy
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate, bobbled, forwardly placed, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Hop to a Decision
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, dropped back,

ENTRY.NAME: Paynt by Number
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled along, off pace turn, engaged leader, drew off,

ENTRY.NAME: Rose Valley
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed 3w, lacked late response,
